name: lindis
text: A comment left by lindis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sevenarts, fosters, tttt2, rascaldom, Sprog, Dwilow, 8i6_1355)

name: hellofyellin
text:
I love you all, and I am a proponent of just quoting what is in a strip. Posters sometimes point out the gold-laden humor that I miss the first-go-round.

Note: This is not sarcasm but genuine sentiment

name: likeiwassaying
text: i agree! i am on my third trek back through the old strips and the saddest moments are when people lame the first post when the guy obviously just loves achewood like we do. why do they have to do a thing?

name: tonyhighwind
text: They are not to be hated.  They believe they are protecting Achewood's honor.  Misguided as their actions are, their hearts are in the right place.

name: hipjiverobot
text: You have five times as many comments as me but 10 times as many chubbies. Congratulations on this.

name: rarelement
text: Achewood works exponentially.

name: erdrick
text: I want to know who's business it is. Or if he just means its no one's business.

name: jlynes
text:
It is no one's business to turn out a funeral. A funeral must not be turned out, because the act of turning it out would seriously diminish the solemnity of the occasion.

It is the wake that can be, nay, MUST BE turned out. The wake provides a joyous counterpart to the funeral, and a way to celebrate the deceased's life, rather than mourn the death.

name: rainwolfj
text: You can't spell FUNeral without fun, I turn those mother's out with no shame!

name: atticusonline
text: It is not your business!

name: libelandslander
text: It is not Ray's business, but it might surely be rainwolfj's

name: mercuri0us
text: Sounds like is talking from personal experience on the funeral.

name: mercuri0us
text: Ray

name: a_dude
text: I like Ray... He sure can turn out a golf course and just about anything else.

name: overmedicated
text: Sorry to be an ignoramus, but how exactly DO you turn a mother out?

text: It's easy. Just evaluate the mother, and see what's missing (until there is a party).

name: cchauffe
text: consult ye olde flowcharte.

name: soticoto
text:
Houses. of. Parliament.

And unlike 2 years ago, I can spell it correctly now. -_-;

name: cailetshadow
text: It is different in every situation. And we need Ray to show us how it is done.

name: dougthehead
text: For example, notice the way Ray adapts to changing circumstances.  When he cannot have Eggs Benedict and a Bloody Mary, he will content himself with laughing at the ugly features of a gas station attendant named Napil.

name: theyang
text:
(quoting straw form Party: Day V post)
[IMGS OFF]

name: fatcat
text: You got to put heat under the sucker.

name: madnes
text: I live to meet a gas station attendant named Napil and derive humor from his appearance.

name: bixschmix
text: However, in a horrible twist of fate, he'll be oddly good-looking, which will completely deflate your fantasy and leave you dissatisfied.

name: odei
text:
Three guys try to turn a mother out, and the whole scene unfolds with a tedious inevitability.

Unless you're drunk, then it's hilarious!

name: tekende
text:
Years later, the memory of Napil will haunt madness's mind. "That cashier's face...why can't I stop seeing it?" she wonders aloud on sleepless nights.

madness will never look like Napil.

Napil will never love madness. So it goes.

So it goes.

name: giantants
text: This is how life is to be lived, essentially.

name: eviltkat
text: DISAGREEMENT BOX

name: dj
text: 100% best part of the strip.

name: hollis
text: Yes.  It is SO Ray.  Internal conflict?  "Nah, not today, thanks."

name: griggs_although
text: there's this twin peaks line where bobby says he's going to turn laura palmer's funeral upside-down and i wonder if this strip is a reference to that

name: kimbo_chop
text: This strip is the one that started it all for me. I was in absolute hysterics reading this, even though I didn't really know what was going on. Hilarious? More like a bloody riot, I was laughing for 2 days straight after reading this.

name: bixschmix
text: Right there with you. This is the one that made me an Achewood convert.

name: phoenixultima
text: Ray is the man we all strive to be. Also the little Ray wearing a graduation cap above the lesson corner is funny.

name: hollis
text: Also, Onstad is once again rocking the internal consistency with the commentary on the Cure.

name: jaminspoon
text: We can not, nor will we, expect less.

name: wildtoddler
text: Thanks to Ray, I now imagine that Braveheart would be a perfect movie for snuggles.  What the hell?

name: timjankowiak
text: Brilliant... but the Ray that I know would sometimes, in lieu of putting some heat under the sucker, tear the roof off of it.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Turn that mother out! -> I just can't right now -> YES! YOU! CAN!

name: ssddr
text: OH NO NOT THE CURE

name: nbgreene
text: i need more basic time of friends

name: henrythecad
text: Can someone enlighten me as to the concept of turning the mother out? I just don't get it.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: It's pretty esoteric. I guess basically "the mother" is any given situation, and one "turns it out" by making it more fun and exciting. Still, it clearly has a deeper, almost mystical resonance for Ray. It is his playa mantra.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Thank you!

name: fosters
text: Why am I not surprised Ronald Reagan is unfamiliar with turning a mother out?

name: zeroasalimit
text: Although a funeral should not be turned out, a wake may and should be turned out. At least from my experience.

name: patkun
text: Right. Next party I go to, I am DEFINATELY taking a leaf out of Ray's book.

name: mike24
text: He is ugly - Hilarious

name: saint
text: it has been said.

name: u2girl03
text: I'm probably going to be marked as LAME for this, but I actually LIKE The Cure.  This strip is still hilarious though...YES! YOU! CAN! Classic.

name: slalvation
text: It is OK to like bands!

name: bixschmix
text: It is a Thing!

text: Who told you that? Liking bands is NOT okay!

name: quaga
text: It's silly to like The Cure!

name: achilleselbow
text: From the amount of times Onstad makes fun of The Cure, I am pretty sure he likes them too. That, and Teodor likes them, so you're in good company. I'd rather hang out with Teodor than Ray any day of the week, unless it is a special day of the week when Ray makes tacos.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: screw that. i'd hang with Ray. and it just so happened that i could abscond with a [[lot]] of money in the midst of one of his Friday Parties...so be it!

name: mountaindewtab
text: Turn that mother out.  Unless you have a stomach ache.

name: gyllstromk
text: hilarious

name: spinynorman
text: I like the idea that every five minutes or so Ray's brain forgets where he is and he has to remind himself. It's like Memento but instead of an injury to his short term memory he's flying on self-esteem, meaningless street-slang, and Dutch vodka.

name: odei
text:
It's the perfect way to have fun all the time.

'Dang, there's no party here!' "Hey guys, I got three bottles of Ketel and 300 watts in the trunk, let's do this!"

text: so perfect!

text: But do you photocopy it and include it in the handouts? BECAUSE THAT'S WHAT IT WOULD MEAN TO TURN A MEETING OUT.

name: snookybutts
text: what's night baseball and how do you play it?

name: mattylite
text: No-peeky baseball: as many cards as you want, but poker rules, threes and nines are wild, fours get you an extra card, you peek you pay some penalty like matching the pot, you flip over til you are winning or til you lose, every time a new person is winning they bet.  I'm sure there are ways to make it a drinking game for those who aren't just drinking as they play anyhow.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i...just figured it was playing a game of ball on a field late in the evening.

name: alzuna
text: Is it just me or with the Braveheart one does everyone hear William Wallace approvingly yelling 'Nice' all deep and manly?

name: odei
text: <strike>Freeedooooom!</strike>  Niiiiiiice!

name: odei
text: I forgot to mention, I hear it as the voice of Chris Morris. "NICE," firm, no-nonsense, it is nice and that is the end of it, we're moving on, why are you still thinking about it?

name: hastooo
text: If you had this tattooed on your back, you'd have to ask the man to make it reversed, so you could see it in the mirror the right way around

name: sweetlips
text: dsdf

name: inthetunk
text: I have searched high and low and do not know what a "Geil-Kuhnz" logic backsiphon prevention bar is, or why it has that name.

name: cracklewater
text:
There are two different options leading into the same flow, which itself has three possible outcomes.

The GKLBPB prevents heat from under the sucker flowing into the box of turning mothers out, which would cause problems in Ray's head.

name: tekende
text: A comment left by tekende was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by cpnglxynchos, puguglypress, botch)

name: cracklewater
text:
Surely one should "cue" Braveheart instead of "queuing" it?

It this Onstad, or is it meant to be Ray's spelling?

Ray (or Onstad) also lacks understanding of the phrase "toe the line".

In every other instance, Onstad seems to be quite masterful with English, so he's either making deliberate mistakes on Ray's behalf, or the act of writing as Ray is clouding his brain

name: tellumo
text:
Naah, most media players refer to adding a file to the list of items to be played as "enqueueing" it--adding it to the queue of pending media. So Ray's saying that he needs to add Braveheart to the list of files he's going to play.

Either that or Ray screwed it up, which is far from unprecedented.

name: middlehead
text: Disagreement Box may be the greatest thing in the history of things.

name: fmercury
text: YES! YOU! CAN! Ray Smuckles was Barack Obama before Barack Obama was.

name: tangles
text: the juxtaposition of disagreement box with the picture of ray on the lesson corner makes me smiley. it's like those things were meant to go together

name: liquidcruelty
text:
I will soon be attending a school of funeral service so that I may be a mortician
On that day, I will get this strip done in my name, so that I always remember that grieving loved ones do not necessarily want anything turned out

name: theguitarhero
text: Especially not their mother.

name: icecube
text: "Throw your hat away in the can and rally"

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
rally.

what does that mean? just that you re-group with your homies, take stock and continue on thereafter?

name: icecube
text: I like that Ray leaves his precise meaning rather vague. It could mean either to rally the homies together, to regroup as you say, or it could mean rally in the individual sense - sort of like having a burst of inspiration.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i like the idea of the first one more.

s'just me, though.

name: presterjohn
text: It's rally as in "boot and rally" as in "vomit so you can drink more" as in "exactly what Ray is proposing" as in "where the heck did you two go to college that you do not know this"

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i haven't "gone to college." i don't "have a degree" or "understand personal space". i don't understand "caves"... i'm just a caveman.

ooooh, two SNL references in one comment. daaaaamn yes!

text: Australia.
